events.title: Saint Valentine's Day Massacre
events.description: Seven members of Chicago's North Side Gang were murdered during the Saint Valentine's Day Massacre, an event linked to the gang warfare between Al Capone and Bugs Moran.
events.significance: Marked a turning point in Chicago gang violence, symbolizing the brutality of Prohibition-era organized crime.

events.title: George Washington becomes First U.S. President by known popular vote
events.description: George Washington was elected as the first President of the United States under the new Constitution, receiving the greatest number of electoral votes.
events.significance: Initiated the presidency of the United States and set precedents for future democratic elections.

events.title: Alexander Graham Bell applies for Telephone Patent
events.description: Alexander Graham Bell filed a patent application for his invention of the telephone, a significant advance in communication technology.
events.significance: Key development leading to the modern telecommunications industry.

events.title: Traditional date of the creation of the world according to James Ussher
events.description: According to 17th-century Archbishop James Ussher's calculation, the biblical creation of the world is dated to this day (though not a historical event, it was influential historically).
events.significance: Reflects historical attempts to date biblical events and influences religious chronologies.

events.title: Martyrdom of Saint Valentine
events.description: Saint Valentine was said to be martyred on this day, leading to the association of February 14 with love and romantic celebration.
events.significance: Basis for the modern celebration of Valentine's Day, influencing cultural and social customs worldwide.
